definition: to decide (to do something)/to resolve/decision/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]/certainly
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to decide without reference to other parties involved/unilateral decision
lit. the butt governs the head (idiom)/fig. where one stands depends on where one sits/one's views are shaped by one's circumstances
pinyin: pi4 gu5 jue2 ding4 nao3 dai5

sentences.english: He self-reflected and decided to decrease the stress and clean up his diet, looking beyond the status quo.
sentences.chinese: 他能自我反醒並決定減少壓力和調整飲食，改變現狀。

sentences.english: We were kept on tenterhooks for hours while the judges chose the winner.
sentences.chinese: 我們坐立不安了好幾個小時，等着裁判們決定獲勝者。

sentences.english: The ICC must decide whether to indict the suspects.
sentences.chinese: 國際刑事法庭必須決定是否起訴這些嫌犯。

sentences.english: None of this will actually be decided at Bali.
sentences.chinese: 所有這一切實際上都決定在巴里島。

sentences.english: Look at my feet, grandma frozen stiff decided to make a pair of cloth padded boots.
sentences.chinese: 看着我凍僵的小腳，奶奶決定給我做一雙布棉鞋。

sentences.english: So I decided to test the system.
sentences.chinese: 因此我決定測試下這個制度。

sentences.english: Deciding microwave anechoic chamber dimensions in terms of measurement project and EUT(equipment under test) dimensions.
sentences.chinese: 根據測試項目和被測件的大小，決定暗室的尺寸。

sentences.english: What I wear depends on the time of the day and thd places that I am going to.
sentences.chinese: 我的穿着是根據當天的時刻和我要去的地點來決定。

sentences.english: We need emotions to make decisions - as in all things, balance is the key.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要情感來做決定，綜合來說，平衡是關鍵。

sentences.english: You should look at that house before you decide to buy it.
sentences.chinese: 你應該看看那棟房子再決定購買。

sentences.english: Boeing says it found problems in the process used to reach the decision.
sentences.chinese: 波音公司表示他在過去做出決定的過程中發現了問題。

sentences.english: They decided to take the path of self-reliance.
sentences.chinese: 他們決定走自力更生的道路。

sentences.english: The Glee Club decided to present an oratorio during their recital.
sentences.chinese: 高興俱樂部的決定提出的清唱劇在其演奏。

sentences.english: It's not a decision you'll regret, even if L.A. winds up losing in a blowout.
sentences.chinese: 即使快船被虐，你也不會後悔這個決定。

sentences.english: He can't say why he decided to become a writer.
sentences.chinese: 他也說不清楚自已是何時決定要當作家的。

sentences.english: Watching from the boat, Mr Kirkconnell is sure Mr Clasen the right decision.
sentences.chinese: 事發時在船上的卡梅倫稱，克拉森作出了正確的決定。

definition: outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
definite/certain/fixed/to fix (on sth)/to determine/to be sure/to ensure/to make certain/to ascertain/to clinch/to recognize/to confirm/OK (on computer dialog box)
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
